intro: Melandrium physocalycinum, commonly known as the yellow poppy, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and distinctive, elongated seed pods. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. The species is also known for its medicinal properties, though it is not widely cultivated for commercial use.
